title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Radford University
Interview Descriptions: Three hour interview on campus with the heads of different departments that the person in this position would be working with. All the interview questions you would expect were asked.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience in similar roles.

title: Online Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Radford University
Interview Descriptions:
Thankfully, I interviewed via Zoom, though the process would have been better handled as a phone screen. The hiring committee was hurried and unfocused, indicating minimal review at the application level; for instance, they appeared to be trying to fit interviews into 10-minute slots, which seemed odd for a Zoom chat with a 6-person team. Again, this could have easily been circumvented with a phone screener.

Each committee member asked one prepared question, three of which I had already responded to in my brief personal introduction. They were unable to provide substantive answers to my questions about the role and seemed neither knowledgeable about the position nor interested in filling it. I will not be responding to any offers or inquiries about further interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you're interested in this role.

title: Service Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Radford University
Interview Descriptions: Email asking for a time to set up an interview.  Then face to face interview and right then and there you will be told if you got the job or not.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness ?

title: Library Position Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Radford University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the search committee, followed by daylong, in-person interview with the library staff, and a presentation. The library staff was very welcoming and accommodating, which helped reduce  job interview jitters.
Interview Questions: How do you keep students engaged during a class session?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Radford University
Interview Descriptions: I submitted CV, samples of work, and references. The interview was with three faculty members who asked prescribed questions. I was told that all the questions were the same that was asked to all applicants. The interview was rather stiff and formal, because the questions were all “canned” and there was no follow-up from the team. Although, they could answer my questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in teaching at Radford?

title: Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Radford University in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with hiring committee of four people. They took turns asking prepared questions. Most questions were specific to the job rather than general questions about strengths and weaknesses, etc.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Radford?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Radford University (Radford, VA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was more nervous than I was so when I noticed that I knew if i did well and made a freindly yet professional suggestion and answered them in words that he/she understood I would get the job. And I did just that, got the job offer in 3 days
Interview Questions: tell me about your previous position

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Radford University
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application on the graduate college's website.
Interview Questions: There was no interview required.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Radford University (Radford, VA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with all constituencies, including chair, department faculty, faculty personnel committee, dean and provost. Also, student committee. The entire process took the totality of two days, including teaching classes.  Excellent process.
Interview Questions: Do I think that the location is too isolated?

title: Study Abroad Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Radford University (Radford, VA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with others Skyping in. Four people on the panel from the department plus two from admissions. Took about 45 minutes and there was time for questions at the conclusion. Overall, relaxed and friendly.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this job in preference to others?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Radford University (Radford, VA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process, just need to maintain a high GPA and demonstrate fellow student that you can master the areas that you were assigned to teach. No background checks or anything of the sort. It was overall an easy interview.
Interview Questions: What is your GPA?

title: Fundraising Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Radford University in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for a fundraising position. I felt the interview went very well, however I did not receive a follow up interview. While the interview process was not particularly difficult, I found the short essay portion challenging. It is wise to study and prepare for interviewing for this position. Expect a panel of a few individuals.
Interview Questions: The interviewers had me write a short e-mail to potential donors.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Radford University in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted over the phone by several different departments within the university before selecting the department I ended up working for. The interview was brief, casual, and over the phone. After the initial interview, I was told I would be contacted in the near future with an offer. I was contacted the very next day and accepted the position, and worked there throughout my two year graduate program.
Interview Questions: My current boss asked me how well I performed in time-sensitive situations.

title: Assistant Trip Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Radford University in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process is simple: you walk into the RU Outdoors office and ask for an application.

The interview: pretty straightforward , asked about my outdoor experience and if I had any wilderness certifications which I did not but they were alright with that.

they really focus on if you don't know something , are you willing to learn it?
Interview Questions: Tell me a funny outdoor mishap or story.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Radford University (Radford, VA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: I knew someone within a department and they asked that I be able to work
Interview Questions: There were no interview questions for this position.
